com.esri.mo2.map.img
Interface ImageServerLayer

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable, DatasetLayer, GroupLayer, ImageLayer, Layer, Searchable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseImageServerLayer
public interface ImageServerLayer
extends ImageLayer, GroupLayer

An ImageServerLayer is a visual representation of one of the supported ImageServers. It is displayed as a GroupLayer that contains one or more sub-Layers. Each of the sub-Layers represents a Layer managed by the ImageServer.

An ImageLayerSource that produces an ImageServerLayer, can initially add all the embedded Layers, then set the CanChange property to false. By setting CanChange to false, it is not possible for outside code to change the contents. For example user controls such as a TOC won't be able to rearrange the embedded Layers.

See Also:
ImageServer

Method Detail

constructSubLayerSnapshot

public SubLayerSnapshot constructSubLayerSnapshot()
Constructs a snapshot of the status of sub-layers in this group layer.

Returns:
the snapshot

setCanChange

public void setCanChange(boolean b)
Sets or resets the CanChange property. When set as True, an ImageLayerSource can add, move, and remove Layers. Once set to False, outside code cannot change the GroupLayer contents.

getCanChange

public boolean getCanChange()
Returns the status of the CanChange property. If this property is set to 'True', then you can dynamically add, remove, or move layers within the ImageServerLayer. Not all ImageServerLayers are capable of this - in those cases, once the layer has been constructed, they cannot be changed.

Returns:
the CanChange property
See Also:
setCanChange(boolean)

getCanChangeOnScale

public boolean getCanChangeOnScale()
An ImageServer implementation may provide support for modifying the contents of an ImageServerLayer dependent on the returned map scale.

Returns:
a boolean value - True == ImageServerLayer supports scale-dependent modifications by server, False otherwise.

reverse

public void reverse()
Reverses the order of layers.
